publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2516 Ms Margo MacDonald: National Asthma Campaign Scotland-That the Parliament congratulates National Asthma Campaign Scotland on its work over the past year in drawing public and parliamentary attention to the long-term condition of asthma which affects over 400,000 people in Scotland; welcomes the National Asthma Campaign's Asthma Audit 2001 and its survey of asthma services in Scotland of winter 2000 which together, for the first time, give a true indication of the work that still needs to be done to tackle the condition, and calls on the Scottish Executive to work with the National Asthma Campaign Scotland in its mission to conquer asthma.
S1M-2516 National Asthma Campaign Scotland (lodged on 4 December 2001) Michael Matheson*, Fergus Ewing*
S1M-2516 National Asthma Campaign Scotland (lodged on 4 December 2001) Michael Russell*

S1M-2516 Ms Margo MacDonald: National Asthma Campaign Scotland-That the Parliament congratulates National Asthma Campaign Scotland on its work over the past year in drawing public and parliamentary attention to the long-term condition of asthma which affects over 400,000 people in Scotland; welcomes the National Asthma Campaign's Asthma Audit 2001 and its survey of asthma services in Scotland of winter 2000 which together, for the first time, give a true indication of the work that still needs to be done to tackle the condition, and calls on the Scottish Executive to work with the National Asthma Campaign Scotland in its mission to conquer asthma. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Fergus Ewing, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*
S1M-2516 National Asthma Campaign Scotland (lodged on 4 December 2001) Fiona McLeod*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Christine Grahame*, Shona Robison*
